intro: Alyssum montanum subsp. regis-borisii, commonly known as the Balkan alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
